SEARCH
Package oogasalad.fileparser

Class HitBoxDataParserTest

java.lang.Object
oogasalad.fileparser.HitBoxDataParserTest
public class HitBoxDataParserTest extends Object
JUnit tests for HitBoxDataParser.

This test class follows the guidelines:

  • Each test method is annotated with @Test.
  • Method names follow the [MethodName_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior] format.
  • The tests cover various scenarios (valid input, invalid numeric values, and missing numeric attributes).

    • loadElementFromString

      private Element loadElementFromString(String xml) throws Exception
      Helper method to create an org.w3c.dom.Element from an XML string.
      Parameters:
      xml - the XML string to be parsed
      Returns:
      the root element of the parsed XML document
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during XML parsing

    • getHitBoxData_ValidInput_ReturnsCorrectHitBoxData

      @Test public void getHitBoxData_ValidInput_ReturnsCorrectHitBoxData() throws Exception
      Tests that a valid hitbox XML element produces a correct HitBoxData record.

      This "One" scenario validates that all hitbox attributes, including shape and numeric values, are correctly parsed.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during XML parsing

    • getHitBoxData_InvalidWidth_ThrowsHitBoxParseException

      @Test public void getHitBoxData_InvalidWidth_ThrowsHitBoxParseException() throws Exception
      Tests that a non-numeric value for hitBoxWidth results in a HitBoxParseException.

      This "Invalid" scenario provides a non-numeric hitBoxWidth value which should trigger a NumberFormatException internally, and then be caught and rethrown as a HitBoxParseException.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during XML parsing

    • getHitBoxData_MissingWidth_ThrowsHitBoxParseException

      @Test public void getHitBoxData_MissingWidth_ThrowsHitBoxParseException() throws Exception
      Tests that a missing numeric attribute (hitBoxWidth) triggers a HitBoxParseException.

      This "Invalid" scenario simulates a missing hitBoxWidth attribute. The parser will attempt to parse an empty string, causing a NumberFormatException that is then rethrown as a HitBoxParseException.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during XML parsing
